title: Oath (song)
text:
"Oath" is a song by English <a href="Singing">singer</a> <a href="Cher%20Lloyd">Cher Lloyd</a>, featuring vocals from <a href="Becky%20G">Becky G</a>. The track was released on 2 October 2012, as the second single from the American version of Lloyd's debut studio album, "<a href="Sticks%20and%20Stones%20%28Cher%20Lloyd%20album%29">Sticks and Stones</a>", and the fourth single overall. "Oath", produced by <a href="Dr.%20Luke">Dr. Luke</a> and <a href="Cirkut%20%28record%20producer%29">Cirkut</a>, was played for the first time on <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a> radio station <a href="WHTZ">Z100</a>. The track was released as a single in the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>, <a href="Canada">Canada</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a> and <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a> only. "Oath" was not as successful as Lloyd's previous single, "<a href="Want%20U%20Back">Want U Back</a>", in the United States, debuting at number 99, and peaking at number 73 on the <a href="Billboard%20Hot%20100">"Billboard" Hot 100</a>. The single was certified gold by the <a href="Recording%20Industry%20Association%20of%20America">Recording Industry Association of America</a> (RIAA) denoting sales of 500,000 in the country. In New Zealand, following the major success of "Want U Back", which reached number three, "Oath" made a respectable impact, peaking at number 13, becoming Lloyd's third consecutive Top 20 hit in that country.
Background.
"Oath" was originally written by <a href="Becky%20G">Rebbeca Gomez</a> but was brought to <a href="Cher%20Lloyd">Cher Lloyd</a> by Dr. Luke. It was later modified by songwriters <a href="Ammar%20Malik">Ammar Malik</a> and <a href="Emily%20Wright">Emily Wright</a>, along with help from producers Dr. Luke, Cirkut and Robopop, for inclusion on Lloyd's second studio album, slated for release in 2013. However, when it was revealed that Lloyd's debut album, "<a href="Sticks%20and%20Stones%20%28Cher%20Lloyd%20album%29">Sticks and Stones</a>", was set to be revised for the American and Australian markets, Lloyd's producers decided to use the track as one of the record's lead singles, and Lloyd asked Gomez to appear on the track with her to sing one of the verses. Thus, "Oath" was released as the album's second single, following "Want U Back", in both the United States and Australia, and also featured on the version of the album released in <a href="Japan">Japan</a>. The track itself premiered on <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a> radio station <a href="WHTZ">Z100</a> on 7 September 2012.
Music video.
The music video for "Oath" was filmed over the course of three days, between 19 and 21 September 2012. The video was directed by <a href="Hannah%20Lux%20Davis">Hannah Lux Davis</a>, and was first previewed in a number of images released via Lloyd's <a href="Twitter">Twitter</a> account. The video premiered in full on 4 October 2012, via Lloyd's official VEVO account on <a href="YouTube">YouTube</a>. The music video has over 146 million views on <a href="YouTube">YouTube</a> as of June 2020.
Synopsis.
The video features Lloyd and Gomez as students in a high school who are kept behind in detention. Lloyd taps her pencil similar to the scene in "<a href="...Baby%20One%20More%20Time%20%28song%29">...Baby One More Time</a>" by <a href="Britney%20Spears">Britney Spears</a>. This scene is cut multiple times by Lloyd sitting on the hood of a red classic convertible <a href="Ford%20Mustang">Ford Mustang</a>. Lloyd and her friends walk to a car filled with pool toys after getting out of school. Gomez begins her verses as she is seen in front of several lockers with "OATH" written on them. After Gomez's first two lines, the scene cuts to two girls who stare at the two singers walking into a laundromat. They pass a man playing "<a href="Want%20U%20Back">Want U Back</a>" on Just Dance 4 and push him aside, and they both pick up a Wii remote to play the game; these scenes are spliced with the girls playing with carts full of clothes. They then walk outside while people look at the group of friends, the men being attracted. The singers dance around the red convertible and a green jeep. The cars drive down a highway to the beach where the friends are seen dancing and playing.
Live performances.
Lloyd performed the song live for the first time on "<a href="On%20Air%20with%20Ryan%20Seacrest">On Air with Ryan Seacrest</a>" on 1 October 2012. She performed the song on "<a href="Today%20%28U.S.%20TV%20program%29">Today</a>" on 5 October, and on "<a href="Live%21%20with%20Kelly%20and%20Michael">Live! with Kelly and Michael</a>" on 28 October 2012. Cher also sang the song with <a href="Becky%20G">Becky G</a> on the American broadcast of "<a href="The%20X%20Factor%20%28U.S.%20TV%20series%29">The X Factor</a>", on the Top 10 results show on 22 November 2012. Lloyd also performed the song while she was a supporting act on <a href="Demi%20Lovato">Demi Lovato</a>'s <a href="Neon%20Lights%20Tour">Neon Lights Tour</a>.
